text.p: -- Hambrecht & Quist said its analyst Chris Galvin raised his earnings estimates for CyberMedia Inc after the company reported fourth-quarter results that beat Hambrecht's estimate.
-- In a statement, Galvin said he boosted his 1997 earnings estimate to $0.35 a share from $0.33 and his 1998 estimate to $0.63 a share from $0.55.
-- CyberMedia reported fourth-quarter profit of $0.01 a share on revenue of $15.8 million versus Hambrecht's forecast of a loss of $0.01 a share on revenue of $11.3 million.
-- Galvin maintains a strong buy rating on the stock.
-- Shares of CyberMedia, which provides service and support software for Windows-based personal computers, were 3/8 higher at 16-1/4 in early afternoon trading on Wednesday.
